alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 6:56PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cherry, northwestern Brown and western Keya Paha Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 656 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Littleburg to near Valentine to near Valentine National Wildlife Refuge. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Valentine, Johnstown, Norden, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Wood Lake, Smith Falls State Park, Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River, North River Trail, Sparks and Big Alkali Lake State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 187 and 234. Highway 97 between mile markers 128 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 186 and 222. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 39, and between mile markers 41 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Western Cherry
